description: Australia will try to rein in a spike in international student arrivals by imposing different speeds of visa processing, in the latest effort by the center-left government to cut migration numbers ahead of an expected tight election.
title: Australia Slows Some Foreign Student Visas After Cap Plan Fails

description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken met Wednesday with Marco Rubio, the senator chosen by President-elect Donald Trump to succeed him as top US diplomat, a small step toward managing a transition between the two administrations that has been unconventional at best.
title: Blinken Meets Rubio as Unconventional Transition Inches Ahead

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior editor Joe Sobczyk looks at the dilemma confronting House Speaker Mike Johnson. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump, Musk Unravel Johnson’s Funding Deal, Boosting Shutdown Risk

description: Families from all over the world are trapped in Mexico, trying to figure out what the new administration’s immigration plan means for their futures.
title: Stranded in Mexico: Trump’s Looming Crackdown Scares Migrants

description: A gauge measuring the level of South African confidence in government policy showed increased levels of uncertainty in December, reflecting concerns about the pace of economic recovery and the likely impact of US President-elect Donald Trump on global trade.
title: Trump, Growth Concerns Add to South Africa Policy Uncertainty

description: The costly truth about US government shutdowns: They don’t save taxpayers a dime.
title: US Government Shutdowns Come With Economic, Productivity Costs

description: President-elect Donald Trump told Fox News he was “totally against” a proposed government funding bill, threatening a stopgap measure that would keep the government open until mid-March.
title: Trump Says He’s Against Stopgap Funding Bill, Fox News Reports

description: While Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson scraped together enough votes to pass a 2025 budget with a patchwork of tax hikes, the city’s fiscal woes are far from over.
title: Chicago Faces More Fiscal Pain Even After Budget Narrowly Passes

description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer held a phone call with Donald Trump on Wednesday, soon after rival Nigel Farage — leader of the right-wing Reform UK party — boasted of his own meeting with the President-elect’s team.
title: Starmer and Trump Hold Phone Call on UK-US Ties, Discuss Ukraine

description: Latvian governing parties unexpectedly pulled nominations for the next central bank governor ahead of a vote scheduled for Thursday, Prime Minister Evika Silina said on social media.
title: Latvian Coalition Delays Central Bank Governor Choice Until January

description: Chrystia Freeland’s decision to resign as Canada’s finance minister isn’t merely a political earthquake that’s shaken Prime Minister Justin Trudeau. It’s set to change the coming trade fight between the US, Canada and Mexico.
title: Trudeau’s Political Crisis Rips Up Playbook for Trade Fight With Trump

description: Air Force Secretary Frank Kendall has told Democratic senators that he shares their security concerns over Elon Musk’s reported contacts with Russian leaders but added that the Pentagon has adequate competition in its space programs to prevent over-reliance on the billionaire’s SpaceX.
title: Musk’s Alleged Russia Contacts Worry US Air Force Chief Kendall

description: Colombia has offered to take custody of Argentina’s embassy in Caracas, where six of opposition leader María Corina Machado’s aides have been sheltered since March.
title: Colombia Offers to Safeguard Maduro Foes as Standoff Deepens

description: Colombia will suspend applications for housing subsidies aimed at helping vulnerable households as problems with the government’s fiscal accounts spill over into social programs.
title: Colombia Suspends Housing Subsidies in Worsening Budget Squeeze

description: Finance Minister Fernando Haddad said the Brazilian real may be facing a “speculative attack” amid a selloff sparked by mounting fiscal concerns.
title: Brazil Finance Chief Says Real May Be Under ‘Speculative Attack’

description: German lawmakers approved the government’s request for €4.7 billion to buy four additional U212CD submarines from Thyssenkrupp Marine Systems GmbH on top of the two already ordered.
title: German Lawmakers Approve €4.7 Billion Order for Submarines

description: Canada is removing a key incentive that gave foreign workers an easier pathway to gain permanent residency, part of a broader crackdown to drastically reduce immigration.
title: Canada Axes Key Incentive for Scammers to Sell Migrants Low-Wage Jobs

description: Argentina’s government is pushing banks to expand dollar lending to more sectors, Economy Minister Luis Caputo told a closed-door event at the Buenos Aires Stock Exchange.
title: Argentina Working With Banks to Expanding Dollar Lending

description: The UK doesn’t plan to hand more money to Mauritius in a deal covering the future of the Chagos Islands, including a key military base, despite the new Mauritian government’s push for improved terms.
title: UK Has No Plans to Hand Mauritius More Money Over Chagos Deal

description: Luxembourg’s prime minister said political instability in Germany, France and other nations is slowing the European Union’s agenda as the bloc seeks to boost competitiveness and prepare for Donald Trump’s second presidency.
title: Power Vacuum at Heart of EU Slows Agenda, Luxembourg Leader Says

description: The US Supreme Court said it will hear TikTok’s challenge to a law that would ban the social media app if it isn’t sold by its Chinese parent company, scheduling arguments on an unusually expedited basis for Jan. 10.
title: Supreme Court Will Hear TikTok’s Challenge to Looming US Ban

description: Washington state’s incoming attorney general, Nick Brown, is gearing up for a high-stakes clash with the second Trump administration, pledging to fight back against Republican policies on immigration, abortion and the environment.
title: Top Cop in Liberal Washington State Sees Room to Work With Trump

description: The UK Treasury has drawn up proposals for closer economic ties with China focused on financial services and clean energy, as Keir Starmer presses ahead with his bid to reset ties despite national security concerns.
title: UK Focuses China Thaw on Closer Banking, Clean Energy Ties

description: The European Commission has started an investigation into Poland’s plan to use state aid for its first nuclear power plant.
title: EU Opens Probe Into State Aid for Poland’s First Nuclear Plant

description: The French Senate adopted a stopgap budget bill to enable the government to keep functioning from January until the country adopts a budget for 2025.
title: France’s Senate Adopts Stopgap Budget Bill for 2025

description: European Union leaders are set to avoid directly calling out China for its support of Russia’s war against Ukraine, according to a draft statement they plan to adopt at a summit in Brussels this week.
title: EU Set to Exclude China in Condemnation of Nations Aiding Russia

description: China reiterated its pledge to maintain peace and stability in the border areas with India as the two countries resumed formal discussion on the subject for the first time in five years.
title: China Vows to Maintain Border Peace With India as Ties Stabilize

description: The US government has launched a national-security investigation into TP-Link, the China-founded router maker whose equipment now dominates the American market and has been targeted in repeated Chinese cyber attacks, people familiar with the matter said.
title: US Probes China-Founded Router Maker on National Security Fears

description: Corruption investigations that ensnared some of China’s top military leaders could hinder modernization goals for the country’s armed forces, delaying efforts to reach key milestones by 2027, according to the US Defense Department.
title: Corruption Probes Could Impair Xi’s Military Vision, US Says

description: President Joe Biden has spent much of the last year trying — and often failing — to contain the spiraling violence in the Middle East. As his term draws to a close, the devastation in Gaza and the new uncertainty in Syria mask some geopolitical gains for Washington — even if Biden’s team wasn’t directly responsible for them.
title: As Biden Term Ends, Middle East Dynamics Look Better for Washington

description: The UK government is being forced to use jobs data from new sources because of shortcomings at the country’s official statistics agency, a minister said, acknowledging the crisis in reliable information that is affecting British economic policy making.
title: UK Government Forced to Use Own Jobs Data Amid Chaos at UK Statistics Agency

description: Turkey-backed forces are aiming to capture more territory in northern Syria from Kurdish groups, according to Turkish officials familiar with the matter, a move that could stir tensions with the US.
title: Turkey-Backed Syria Forces Aim to Push on Against Kurdish Groups

description: These leaders face an especially challenging year.
title: On the Hot Seat for 2025: Sundar Pichai, Kristi Noem and More

description: Democratic Senator Elizabeth Warren urged the Biden administration to advance a proposed rule before Donald Trump takes office to crack down on insurance companies that she says are overcharging Medicare by more than $80 billion.
title: Warren Seeks Faster Crackdown on Insurers Overcharging Medicare by Billions

description: Israel’s deputy foreign minister said Syria’s new leaders are “wolves in clothes of sheep,” who are trying to persuade the world they are not radical Islamists — but her government isn’t convinced.
title: Wary Israel ‘Not Fooled’ by New Syria Leaders, Minister Says

description: Housing rents in London are soaring at the fastest pace on record after a resurgence that deepens the crisis facing the city’s tenants.
title: London Rents Rising at Record Pace Add to Pressure on Labour

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Watch El Salvador for Clues to Trump’s Strategy

description: Donald Trump lobbed a fresh taunt at Canada as Prime Minister Justin Trudeau tries to weather a crisis sparked by the sudden departure of a minister who was a bulwark against the US president-elect’s plan to start trade wars with his neighbors.
title: Trump Publicly Taunts Trudeau Saying Canada Should Be a US State

description: El Salvador’s Bitcoin holdings soared with Donald Trump’s election victory. The President-elect’s migration stance may be more problematic for his ally Bukele’s economic plans.
title: Crime’s Plunge and Bitcoin’s Boom Still Leave El Salvador Chasing Economic Miracle

description: NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte will host Volodymyr Zelenskiy and several European leaders at his residence in Brussels on Wednesday evening to discuss how to support Ukraine ahead of Donald Trump’s return to the White House.
title: Europe and Zelenskiy to Discuss Ukraine Support in New Trump Era

description: Scott Bessent, President-elect Donald Trump’s pick to run the Treasury Department, will meet with frequent Wall Street critic and Democratic Senator Elizabeth Warren on Wednesday, part of a series of meetings he’s having on Capitol Hill ahead of his confirmation hearings next month.
title: Treasury Pick Bessent to Meet Elizabeth Warren on Capitol Hill

description: For more than a year, Russia has leaned on its increasingly close ally North Korea for supplies of artillery shells and ballistic missiles to prosecute a grinding war in Ukraine. In October, the partnership entered a new phase as Pyongyang dispatched thousands of soldiers to bolster Russia’s armed forces. Ukrainian and western officials have described their appearance on the battlefield as a major escalation by Moscow. North Korea’s foreign minister promised her country would stick with Russia u
title: Why Thousands of North Koreans Are Fighting in Russia

description: Bank Indonesia Governor Perry Warjiyo vowed to cooperate with a corruption probe of the central bank, which was raided earlier this week by the country’s anti-graft agency.
title: Indonesia Central Bank Cooperates With Graft Probe of CSR Funds

description: Syria’s main airports resumed operations for the first time following the fall of Bashar Al Assad’s regime, bringing back an element of normalcy to the war-torn country.
title: Syria’s Airports Restart Flights for First Time Since Assad Fall

description: Fitch Ratings signaled it may cut Romania’s credit grade, citing high political uncertainty that’s likely to delay plans to reduce the European Union’s highest budget deficit ahead of a presidential election re-run next year.
title: Fitch Cuts Romania Credit Outlook and Warns of Budget Fix Delay

description: The European Union and South American nations have spent more than a quarter of a century trying to strike a deal on free trade. The negotiations took on new urgency this year as a looming trade war between the world’s biggest trading partners — the US and China — spurred other regions to seek out new commercial partnerships to soften the blow.
title: Why an EU-South America Trade Deal Is Finally in Sight

description: Russian authorities detained an Uzbekistan national on suspicion of killing a top general in a Moscow bomb attack, and said he’d been recruited by Ukrainian security services to carry out the assassination.
title: Russia Detains Suspect in Killing of General, Blames Ukraine

description: Bank of Korea Governor Rhee Chang-yong said Wednesday that the ongoing political turmoil in South Korea weighs on the economy, suggesting authorities may downgrade growth forecasts and take stabilizing actions in response.
title: BOK’s Rhee Expects Martial Law Turmoil to Hurt Economic Growth

description: There is arguably no leader in all of Europe who’s more chummy, or ideologically aligned, with Donald Trump than Hungary’s Viktor Orban.
title: Trump Trade Comes to Europe, Giving Jolt to Cheap Hungary Market

description: As the country comes to terms with the regime’s demise, no issue is more fraught than the fate of those who disappeared.
title: After 150,000 People Vanished, Syrians Hunt for Assad’s Victims

description: The UK government risks baking in higher energy costs for consumers as it pushes to meet a challenging — and upgraded — target to decarbonize the country’s power supply by 2030.
title: UK’s Accelerated Clean Power Push Risks Raising Energy Bills

description: Brazil’s lower house approved the first part of President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s plan to target 70 billion reais ($11.5 billion) in spending with changes that water down some efforts to address investors concerns over the country’s public accounts.
title: Lula Sees His Fiscal Plan Weakened in Brazil Lower House Vote

description: President-elect Donald Trump said he would nominate former football star Herschel Walker as his ambassador to the Bahamas.
title: Trump Will Nominate Herschel Walker as Ambassador to Bahamas

description: A defiant Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, all smiles at his political party’s end-of-year festivities, tried to downplay the most serious challenge yet facing his leadership.
title: Trudeau Tries to Brush Off Deputy’s Exit as Festive Family Spat

description: Japan’s support for Rapidus Corp. won’t waver even if the government-backed venture has to delay its goal of mass producing advanced logic chips by 2027, according to the chairman of the ruling party’s group for semiconductors.
title: Japan to Support Rapidus Even if It Delays Goal, Chip Czar Says

description: South Korea’s impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol skipped questioning by a joint investigation team on Wednesday, according to local media reports, increasing the risk of his arrest.
title: South Korea’s Yoon Skips Questioning, Adding to Risk of Arrest

description: During a trip to Taiwan last year, Florida congressman Mike Waltz stressed the US needed to embrace “strategic clarity” and spell out to China that an invasion of the island would be met with a strong US response.
title: For Waltz, Advising Isolationist Trump Is Taiwan-Sized Challenge

description: Congressional negotiators reached agreement on more than $100 billion in emergency relief funding for victims of a series of disasters including back-to-back hurricanes that hit the US Southeast and a bridge collapse in Baltimore.
title: US Lawmakers Agree to More Than $100 Billion in Disaster Relief

description: North Korean forces deployed in Russia’s Kursk region have suffered several hundred casualties in clashes with Ukrainian troops, US officials said Tuesday.
title: Ukrainians Inflict Casualties on North Korean Forces, US Says

description: None of the mysterious drones reported over the skies of the US Northeast are being flown by the Pentagon or are part of secret government tests, a Defense Department spokesman said Tuesday.
title: US Says Pentagon Is Not Behind Mysterious Drone Flights
